intro: Otoglossum arminii, commonly known as the Armenian orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive lip. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats, preferring cool and moist environments. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
